value.title: Calculating Stock on Hand Using DAX   Power BI Inventory Model
value.excerpt: You don't have always the luxury of having a snapshot fact table that has the stock on hand value for every single day, at every single workshop, and for every single product. Even if you want to build such a table, it can get easily gigantic. In this video, I am going to show you how you can use DAX
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Wr4o5uneFxc" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Combining Tables in Power BI   Union Except and Intersect in DAX
value.excerpt: Power Query is often the engine used for combining data tables, especially using Merge or Append. However, sometimes, you might need to do that operation in DAX. An example of that is when you want to create that combination only virtually as part of a measure calculation that evaluates dynamically.
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/IPziqmQgJFw" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Creating Calendar Table in Power BI using DAX Functions
value.excerpt: I have previously explained about using Power Query for creating calendar tables, However, some people still love to do that in DAX. There are a couple of DAX functions which makes the process of creating a calendar table very simple and easy; Calendar() and CalendarAuto(). In this short video, I'll
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/_dd6kiYEm70" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Find Lost Customers Using Power BI and DAX
value.excerpt: In this video, you will learn how to use Power BI and DAX to find lost customers and new customers easily. If you want to see step by step blog post details, read it here: 'http://radacad.com/lost-customers-dax-calculation-for-power-bi
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/m1uupRDWzQw" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Get the Day of the Week Name and Number in Power BI Using DAX
value.excerpt: If you don't have a date table with a column that represents the day of the week name (Saturday, Sunday, Monday etc) or number (from zero to six, or from one to seven), and you just have a date field, which you want to quickly get the day name of the week, here is a quick trick for you. Read my blog
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/hJJnyr1qxtk" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Substring in DAX   How to get Part of String Field in Power BI Using DAX Expression
value.excerpt: Substring is one of the most common functions in many languages, However, there is no such function in DAX. There is a very simple way of doing it, which I am going to explain in this post. Substring means getting part of a string, for example from "Reza Rad", if I want to get the start starting from
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/WEelCk04dYw" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Filtering a measure in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: DAX Studio can evaluate one or more measures in a query. Marco Russo shows how to apply filters to a measure executed in DAX Studio. Continuous learning to improve your productivity!  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/ZIJDv3J9kko" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Mark as Date Table in Power BI
value.excerpt: Tabular models (including Power BI) require marking the Date table as a date table to get appropriate results with time intelligence calculations. This video explains why this setting is required. Article and download: https://sql.bi/670749
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/hrhEjg9yYvE" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Understanding Performance Analyzer metrics in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: Performance Analyzer metrics imported in DAX Studio provide many details not available in Power BI Desktop. Learn the meaning of each number and how to use them to find report bottlenecks. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/aYXRx0pZZcs" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Using USERELATIONSHIP in DAX
value.excerpt: This video shows how to use the USERELATIONSHIP function in DAX to change the active relationship in a CALCULATE function. Article and download: https://sql.bi/664175
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/zZLH8Y1tO1g" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Year-to-date filtering weekdays in DAX
value.excerpt: Time intelligence functions oftentimes hide an automatic ALL statement meant to make time intelligence calculations easier. This video describes this behavior and what to do in case it ends up breaking your calculation. Article and download: https://sql.bi/123591
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/JS-K2faCiCc" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Modify DAX filter context in Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: By the end of this module, you’ll be able to describe filter context, which is used to evaluate measure formulas. You’ll then learn why some calculations need to modify filter context and that it can be achieved by using the CALCULATE function. Additionally, you’ll learn how to configure the CALCULATE function with filters and filter modifiers.

value.title: Calculate Totals for  MTD, QTD and YTD in DAX
value.excerpt: Learn how to quickly use the CALCULATE function to get total from year to date, month to date and quarter to date in Power BI using a Calendar table and time intelligence functions in DAX.
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/qiLjmKoP9ag" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: How to Use CALCULATE in Power BI
value.excerpt: This is one of the most import function to master in Power BI. You can filter your data and create complex measure such as year over year comparisons with ease with these easy to follow tutorial. More more help this function.
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/B6w0IeLMZok" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: #5 DAX Fridays! 101: Order of evaluation for DAX formulas

value.title: DAX Fridays! #105: ISINSCOPE
value.excerpt: The DAX function ISINSCOPE, allow us to work with hierarchies in Power BI. In this video I will go through an example on how to do that. This DAX function was introduced in the November 2018 Power BI Desktop Update, so make sure you have that installed if you wan to test it out.  Other resources:  DAX
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/sSUCyps_1O4" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: DAX Fridays! #11: Using variables in DAX
value.excerpt: Variables are an extremely useful feature in DAX, but perhaps not a well known one. Variables, 1. Make your formulas more readable 2. You can reuse them through your report 3. Can also be tables 4. Are more efficient  Download our Growth dashboard if you want to see the example live:http://curbal.com/blog/the-ultimate-dashboard-to-track-your-website-growth-with-google-analytics-and-power-bi-supercharged-excel

value.title: DAX Fridays! #112: Remove blanks from hierarchies with ISINSCOPE
value.excerpt: In today's video I am going to show you how you can remove blanks from hierarchies using the DAX Function ISINSCOPE.  I have covered ISINSCOPE before with a more difficult example, so I hope this video will explain it in easier terms and with a useful example.  Link to the previous ISINSCOPE video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sSUCyps_1O4

value.title: DAX Fridays #16: DATEADD
value.excerpt: DATEADD is a really useful function to create sets of dates backwords or forward from a point in time. It is used for Previous date calculations. value.title: DAX fridays! #19: DIVIDE
value.excerpt: Let's go through DIVIDE() function available in DAX!  The DIVIDE function performs divisions and returns alternate result or BLANK() on division by 0.It is faster than the simple division operator.  NEXT VIDEO: - PREVIOUS VIDEO: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SsZseKOgrWQ   Looking for a download file?
